title.narrative: HIV/AIDS PREVENTION PROGRAMMES

description.narrative: Selected MDAs, LGAs and NSAs implement evidence-based HIV prevention programmes, which contributes to Adolescents And Hiv/Aids, Hiv Prevention. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Improved and equitable use of proven HIV prevention and treatment interventions by adolescents

sector.narrative: HIV testing including self testing and counselling in adolescents
Harm reduction among adolescent drug users

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Selected MDAs, LGAs and NSAs implement evidence-based HIV prevention programmes

description.narrative: Disseminated findings from evaluation of adolescent girls empowerment intervention model; created demand for key HIV services through evidence based HIV prevention and behaviour change communication (BCC) interventions; validated Swahili BCC information package for young people to be used across se | Status:On-track | As-of Date:28/07/2016

title.narrative: of regional HIV strategic plans developed with implementation underway in 10 high prevalence regions (including high impact interventions for adolescents and young people

target.value: 2016:Regional HIV/AIDS Strategic Plans, informed by region-specific health service data and data on key drivers of the epidemic, in place in 4 high HIV prevalence regions

actual.value: 2016:25 regional HIV/AIDS Strategic Plans (RHASPs 2015-2018) finalized and 4 launched (Iringa, Mbeya, Tanga, Tabora and Kagera). Draft regional monitoring and evaluation plans also in place for Dar es Salaam, Iringa, Mbeya, Njombe).

title.narrative: % of adolescents (10-19) with comprehensive knowledge on HIV/AIDs
% of health facilities that have trained staff delivering youth-friendly services according to national guidelines

baseline.value: Iringa 5.6%, Mufindi 0%, Mbeya 7.0%, Mbarali 19.0%, Makete 45%, Njombe 1.4%

title.narrative: % of women 15-24 in high prevalence regions having comprehensive knowledge of HIV prevention methods

baseline.value: Iringa/Njombe 62% (15-19 years), 78% (20-24 years) Mbeya 65% (15-19 years), 75% (20-24 years), Dar es Salaam 72% (15-19 years) 76% (20-24 years) (DHS 2010 subanalysis)

title.narrative: Status of life skills in and Out of School curricula and teaching

baseline.value: Limited inclusion of Life Skills in existing curriculums and teaching

target.value: 2016:Comprehensive Sexuality Education (CSE) Training Guide and Materials developed, National CSE TOTs available

actual.value: 2016:Review of Sexual and Reproductive Health Education Policies, Guidelines, and Resources in the Tanzanian Education Sector: December 2015 available (TACAIDS, UNICEF efforts)
